APOXI Defines

Collaboration diagram for APOXI Defines:

Compiler defines which are used to configure the source code. More...

Detailed Description

Compiler defines which are used to configure the source code.

Defines, respectively compiler defines, are not used to modify the build-process, but they have impact on the source-code directly. Defines can be related to the features, system environment, but they can also stand of their own.


Naming conventions and usage instructions:

  • All APOXI defines must start with APOXI_.
  • Feature names must be clear and unambiguous.
  • All APOXI defines are only allowed to be used in the scope of APOXI source code.
  • All APOXI defines must be documented and regularly updated in the file apoxi.defines.
  • If a new feature is introduced and this feature is managed by one major feature define, then the postfix SUPPORT must be used as functionality description, like APOXI_<feature>_SUPPORT.
  • If an existing source-code (e.g. interface …) must be disabled for any reason an optional define must be created, with the syntax APOXI_DISABLE_<functionality>.
  • Configuration defines must always have a default value set in the source code, which is used if no value is set from outside.
  • Temporary defines must regularly be checked if they are outdated. Outdated defines have to be removed.
  • All defines must follow the naming convention described for each define type.
